description.narrative: IFC''s financing will contribute to the development of a large-scale modern farming operation which will improve land productivity and have a demonstration impact on other neighboring farms. Mriya''s land and operations are located in Western Ukraine in the Ternopil, Ivano-Frankivsk, Chernivtsi and Khmelnitsky regions. These four regions are amongst the poorest regions in the country. Development impact of the project will be as follows: Employment: Mriya has approximately 1,002 permanent employees and 623 seasonal employees. The project is expected to increase permanent employment to about 1700 and seasonal employment to about 900. In the western Ukraine where Mriya operates, employment opportunities are scarce. In addition to creating new jobs, Mriya is setting new employment standards in the region by providing benefits to its farm workers such food and housing. Environmental and Social Standards: As part of the Environmental and Social Action Plan (ESAP), Mriya will implement an ESMS to provide a structured framework to identify and act on environmental and social risks and opportunities in the management of its agricultural operations as well as down-stream in the agricultural value chain, in the operations of the Sponsor-owned affiliated sugar beet processing plants. Private Sector Development: Mriya sells its products to a well diversified base of final customers and traders. Among them, there currently are about 55 MSME distributors of mainly potatoes, buckwheat, and corn, for final sales on the domestic market. On the purchasing side, Mriya relies on about 27 MSME suppliers, in addition to several large key ones, for deliveries of fertilizers, plant protection chemicals, and spare parts.

The project involves providing a three-year renewable working capital facility to Mriya, a leading Ukrainian primary agricultural producer with a proven track record of growing wheat, barley, sugar beet, rapeseed, potatoes, and other crops. The three-year facility will provide financing of inputs needed for agricultural production to produce agricultural commodities for sale to local clients and international traders.
